Patch Set 13:

(5 comments)

We don't need to check if PFR is provisioned or not provisioned again here. 
We need to set checkpoint in both the cases so again if else not required
If we want to exit the service in un provisoned case , i think we can keep if else
Ack
please avoid the service exit here, and please follow below comment to optimize this function.
With suggested Changes pfr service is existing ,before setting checkpoint in unprovisioned mode

you can move this code to "checkAndSetCheckpoint" so that boot complete signal match and boot finish timestamp checking code will be in the same flow and you can set the boot complete checkpoint if any one of the condition becomes true.
With suggested Changes pfr service is existing ,before setting checkpoint in unprovisioned mode.
please call "checkAndSetCheckpoint" function from here and retain the service exit.
With suggested Changes pfr service is existing ,before setting checkpoint in unprovisioned mode
Please move this code to setBMCBotCheckpoint . If signal matching is happening first , mailbox update will fail.
Done
what is a use of this variable ?
As per offline discussion with Vikram suggested to rename variable   finishedSettingChkPoint to BMCBootCompleteChkPointDone
why we are removing it from here ?
As per offline discussion with vikram suggested to remove this finishedSettingChkPoint and it should calling inside setBMCBootCompleteChkPoint function
"PFR is not provisioned, hence exit the service."
Done
why this line position got altered ?
Done
Can update title as "Set BMC boot complete checkpoint in unprovision mode"
Done
After setting checkpoint, Did you verified the service is existing or not? Please confirm
Yes, Service is existing after setting checkpoint
